data.translation: able to think and learn in a good and quick way
extremely clever, talented, or impressive
mentally healthy and not affected by any mental disorder or illness

good at learning things, understanding ideas, and thinking clearly
showing sensibility and wisdom, especially in avoiding risks or making decisions

relating to goals or ideals that inspire ambition or desire for achievement

displaying or having creativity or originality

quick and clever with their words, often expressing humor or cleverness in a sharp and amusing way

following the same course of action or behavior over time

avoiding work or activity and preferring to do as little as possible

having a distrustful or negative outlook, often believing that people are motivated by self-interest
having or showing a negative view of the future and always waiting for something bad to happen

holding or promoting extreme opinions in politics, religion, etc.
supporting traditional values and beliefs and not willing to accept any contradictory change

showing no mercy or compassion towards others in pursuit of one's goals
finding pleasure, particularly sexual pleasure in hurting or humiliating others

displaying casual disrespect towards others or situations

lacking confidence and needing to be emotionally supported a lot

experiencing frequent changes in mood, often without apparent reason or explanation

not open or responsive to new ideas, suggestions, or experiences

showing respect to what other people say or do even when one disagrees with them

acting in accordance with one's conscience and sense of duty

inclined to deceive or betray others for personal gain or advantage
extremely evil or shockingly wicked in a way that deeply disturbs or offends
having or showing a strong desire to harm others

title: Adjectives of Positive Temporary Mental States

data.translation: not showing worry, anger, or other strong emotions
having a strong desire for doing or experiencing something
having the ability to learn or understand quickly
satisfied and happy with one's current situation or circumstances
not having favoritism or prejudice toward any particular side or viewpoint
feeling or showing emotional attachment or nostalgia toward a person or thing
indebted or obligated to someone because of a favor or kindness they have done
allowing others to enjoy pleasures or desires without strict judgment or criticism
paying close attention and concentrating on a specific goal, activity, or task
having a strong desire or ambition to achieve a goal or accomplish a task
feeling free from worry, stress, or anxiety after a challenging or difficult situation
paying intense attention or effort towards a specific task or activity
having or displaying a strong will to achieve a goal despite the challenges or obstacles
fully committed and loyal to a task, cause, or purpose
feeling or showing gratitude or thankfulness towards someone or something
giving much attention to something or someone with interest
expressing or feeling appreciation and thankfulness for something received or experienced
giving attention or thought to what we are doing to avoid doing something wrong, hurting ourselves, or damaging something
(of a person) having a positive attitude and believing that good things are likely to happen
feeling or expressing gratitude or appreciation for something received or experienced
having or showing intense excitement, eagerness, or passion for something
having careful awareness of one's actions and surroundings
showing warmth and friendliness to a guest or visitor
expressing no fear when faced with danger or difficulty
unable to speak for a short time, particularly as a result of surprise, shock, or anger
engaged in deep or serious thought
remaining calm and in control of one's emotions and actions, especially in challenging situations
involving deep contemplation or examination of one's thoughts and feelings

title: Adjectives of Negative Temporary Mental States

data.translation: feeling so hopeless that one is willing to take any action, regardless of the possible consequences
experiencing or creating a sense of sadness or hopelessness in a situation or atmosphere
overly tense or anxious in various situations
(of a person) inclined to speaking irritably or responding in a sharp or offensive manner
feeling tired, annoyed, or frustrated with a situation or person
very nervous in a way that makes one unable to think clearly
displaying visible signs of mental or emotional pressure
mentally unstable or behaving erratically in a way that is unusual or extreme
having a calm or restrained manner
having a preference or unfair judgment toward one side or viewpoint over others
feeling anger because of perceived unfairness or wrongdoing
characterized by strong feelings of dislike and annoyance
filled with fear or anxiety
greatly frightened and worried about something, in a way that is uncontrollable
deserving pity due to perceived weakness or sadness
feeling unhappy or resentful because someone has something one wants
lacking strength or power, often feeling unable to act or influence a situation
not paying enough attention to what we are doing
prone to annoyance or frustration
having thoughts or intentions about ending one's own life
experiencing or displaying extreme and uncontrolled emotion, such as laughter or crying
unable to concentrate or focus due to having one's attention drawn away by various thoughts or external interruptions
(of a person) having difficulty making choices or decisions, often due to fear, lack of confidence, or overthinking
nervous or worried that something unpleasant may happen
feeling irritable or angry due to hunger
physically or mentally strained, often due to stress, anxiety, or anticipation

title: Adjectives of Neutral Temporary Mental States

data.translation: having an understanding or perception of something, often through careful thought or sensitivity
lacking knowledge or realization of a fact or situation
not welcoming or willing to do something because it is undesirable
(of a person) feeling confident about something being correct or true
uncertain or reluctant to act or speak, often due to doubt or indecision
able to notice things or think quickly
feeling or showing caution and attentiveness regarding possible dangers or problems
not showing any concern in one's attitude or actions toward a particular person, situation, or outcome
having a strong resolve or determination to achieve a particular goal or outcome
having contradictory views or feelings about something or someone
unable to make a decision or form a definite opinion about a matter
reacting to people and events quickly and in a positive way
eager, interested, or ready to do something
reluctant or resistant to do something
not aware of potential danger or harm
having awareness of one's surroundings
lacking awareness or perception of something
having knowledge or awareness about something
